text: I think we figured that all out a year ago, man. Now you and the other two knonckers up there can move on to figuring out what the relationship is beyond the glaringly obvious.

text: Man, I try to be nice about you and you gotta be like that ? Man, fuck you.

text:
Asherdan is not hemerrhoids...
Just telling you cos some folk have trouble knowing the difference.

name: saint
text: Buzzinga.

name: flynn
text: I like Ray stumbling out of frame here.

name: moraiat
text: I think sneaking or stalking is more of his inclination in panel one.

name: apmihal
text: I disagree. Ray has been sort of stoned for the last few strips. To me this strip exists for the sole purpose of showing Ray stumbling around in the background. But of course that could just be because I love the Ray is Stoned story arc so much

name: mikeronomicon
text: Dudes dig chicks that are mean to them. I dig chicks that can defeat me in Street Fighter.

name: tekende
text:
Chicks seem to dig dudes who are mean to them, too.

"I know he cheated on me four times, killed my mother, and had a baby with my cousin, but he's a good guy underneath it all. I can change him, I just know it."

name: apocowarg
text:
I have a friend that consistently falls for guys with deep seated issues that manifest in them being huge twat-otters to her.

She pulls out that "I know he's a good person underneath it." all the time. I told her to try to find someone that doesn't force her to scrape through ten layers of shit to find a glint of gold.

She does not listen to me.

name: rowboat
text:
It's 'cause rough dudes with emotional scars connected with wrong-side-of-the-trackedness generally fuck like there's no tomorrow 'cause there often ain't one. As depressing as it may be to an entire generation of effete milquetoasts who were raised on the belief that being nice is enough, a stellar trailer rocker often means more to your average twenty-something than a good-natured, shoulder-to-cry-on type.

Consolation: When she hits her thirties and gets ready to settle down, you'll be at the top of her list.

name: rowboat
text: For the record, I am from a rare socioeconomic niche which has afforded me views from both sides of the divide. This is why I feel I can speak with authority on the matter.

name: apocowarg
text:
Oh god, I hope my comment didn't read as if I was one of those losers that whine about being stuck in the "friend zone" and think "I wish she would just see how good we would be together" as the knight in shining armor stands awkwardly on the porch holding her purse, while her asshole boyfriend (that has what he says are prison tats, even though it is pretty clear he just broke a pen, dipped a thumbtack in ink and punctured fail all over his arms) gives her the ol' Gopher in the Wet Glutch in the backseat of your Honda Civic.

I don't find my friend attractive and I'm not a "nice" guy. Though I was a couple times when I was young enough to be excused for the naivety. I just want her to get a dude that deserves her awesomeness.

name: rowboat
text: Oh, I wasn't callin' ya out or nothin'. If anything, I was addressing myself. I've taken it too far in both directions at one time or another.

name: apocowarg
text: Ditto.

name: applebed
text: Ultra Peanut would definitely play as Chun Li

name: aperson
text: Ha ha, nice avicon.

name: soticoto
text:
How dangerous that would be depends on which Street Fighter we're talking about.
At least back in the SF2 days, Chun Li was top-tier... so broken that playing as her in Versus-mode was banned in my household. Wasn't a single guy in the house who couldn't beat any other character with Chun-Li.

Later generations though? She got toned down. Her Hyakuretsukyaku got nerfed, among other things. Ryu sorta took over as the standard top-tier then.

name: samspud
text: She's top tier in 3rd Strike.

name: tasteful
text: one of the few instances in which ray's tail is visible

name: boheeka
text: I see ray standing there and wonder if the last couple of strips have just been in his head.

name: wangflop
text: FeeReep totally goes Gandhi on the robot's ass.

name: hellaedgar
text: And Phillipe just stands there watching the "Entering Enemy Mode" meter climb up to 100%.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Yeah. If there's a lesson here, I think its "if you see a robot entering enemy mode, don't stick around!".

name: tinhand
text:
Ultra Peanut is barely around anyway. There are barely any kids in Achewood.
Also; why doesn't Philippe live with his mum?

name: deancain29
text: I dont think you should question Achewood. I try to be zen about it - just accept.

name: anzio
text:
Because Philippe is an immortal 5 year old stuffed otter who is passed from family to family as they all slowly age to the point they can't take care of him, in which they send him to live with another family. Because he is five, he eventually forgets the previous family and at some point thinks he is a member of the family he is currently with.

Or

I smoked a lot of weed and just started typing away...

name: soilentshuggah
text: Phlut.

name: henrythecad
text: It's a safe bet that Ray won't be turning the mother out today, as seen in the first panel.

name: denise
text: i forget that their cats and that they have tails

name: shirt145
text: I wonder if there is a hole in the back of Ray's thong for his tail or if he just pushes it to the side? If so, which side?  Also, maybe I need to not think about this anymore.

name: rowboat
text: Yes, there is a hole and no, I'm not hunting around for links to prove it.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
And to think that all of this time I thought you were a hole man, rowboat.

I'm disappointed.

text: Ultra Peanut is such a bitch.

text: If I was 5 and an otter, I'd hit it.

text: Anyone else who has broke up with a someone using an email address they then stopped checking will understand Phillipe's dread at Why you no call me two year?

text: Love how Philippe is too polite to get Click Robot off himself, just lets himself get burned and looks a little bit worried. Aw.

text: Ultra Peanut is five.

text: It would be interesting if she did age though. Then Philippe could experience heartache like I have.

text: I'm sorry, irateturk. Do you also have a girlfriend who ages while you do not? It is the saddest thing.

text:
[IMGS OFF]
The saddest thing.

name: carlyle
text: He's sassy!

name: greenkoolayd
text: click robot must be a chick.........

name: mangtastic
text: Ultra Peanut refers to Click Robot as a "he" so I am guessing probably not.

name: mangtastic
text: Also it seems ironic to me that you, a person who has frequently called people either "dumbass" or "idiot" and so on, would make such an oversight.

name: greenkoolayd
text:
i was making fun of HIM because HE is being overly dramatic and emotionally weak. turn your sarcasm detector back on, this is the internet.

it seems unnecesary for you to take so much to heart on a messageboard about achewood.

name: mangtastic
text:
Sarcasm is hard to read in just text sometimes. It's not a totally obvious thing you know.

I chubby your comment to make amends.

name: gingerkid
text: I am so happy Ultra Peanut is back!!!

name: aaron_haynes
text: This one has a dreamlike feel to it. Like when you dream about a friend you haven't seen in years and your subconscious creates the second half of an unresolved conversation. Or revisits awkward moments so you can try to justify them to the people involved over and over again.
